title: Self-Portrait with Raised Bare Shoulder
description: An expressive self-portrait reflecting alienation, raw emotion, and bodily distortion.
notes: The shoulder is rendered as an ambiguous body part representing psychological fragmentation. A core theme of Viennese Modernism.

title: Kneeling Female in Orange-Red Dress
medium: Black chalk and gouache on paper
description: Erotic tension conveyed through color, pose, and gaze.
notes: The model, Schiele’s sister Gertrude, appears tense and tightly framed within the composition.

title: The Embrace (The Lovers)
description: A depiction of intimacy and emotional isolation, showing two figures physically close but emotionally distant.
notes: One of Schiele’s key explorations of intimacy in his later years.

title: Reclining Woman
description: A sensual and direct portrayal of the female nude with no narrative context.
notes: Believed to be modeled by Edith Schiele; exhibited at the Vienna Secession in 1918.

title: Self-Portrait as Kneeling Nude
medium: Black chalk and gouache on brown paper
description: A raw nude self-portrait exploring vulnerability and expressive distortion.
notes: Emphasizes the split between self-perception and physical presentation.

title: Rear View of a Female Half-Nude with Cloth (Fragment of Conversion II)
description: A fragment of an unfinished monumental painting, presenting female nudity in a symbolic and allegorical context.
notes: Part of Schiele’s lost large-scale symbolic works, influenced by Ferdinand Hodler.

title: Lovers
description: An unfinished work portraying a couple in an emotionally complex embrace.
notes: Completed shortly before Schiele’s death in 1918.

title: Squatting Female Nude
medium: Black chalk, gouache, opaque white on paper
description: An unembellished and confrontational nude that resists objectification.
notes: The model’s posture and framing challenge traditional passive representations.

title: Black-Haired Man, Sitting
medium: Pencil, India ink with brush, watercolor on brown paper
description: A compact and introspective male portrait with expressive ink work.
notes: One of Schiele's earlier male studies revealing his evolving style.

title: The Mother and the Daughter
description: A depiction of generational closeness and the female bond.
notes: Paired with 'Two Nude Women, Kneeling' on the verso.

title: The Mother and the Daughter
description: A depiction of generational closeness and the female bond.
notes: Paired with 'Two Nude Women, Kneeling' on the verso.
